Row.Text: Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Andor. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Andor provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Andor. +4 [ICON_Food] Food from domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. New cities within Trade Route range of the capital start with a road to it.
Bonus Culture for every City-State to which Greece is the Suzerain. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +3 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for Andor.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +3 [ICON_Science] Gold for Tar Valon.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Additional Military policy slot.
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. All Camps gain +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Hills. Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra.
If you fall, I'll take up your sword
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. All Camps gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and Lumbers gain +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

All Cavalry Units push enemys back if they are victorious in combat. Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Saldea (+1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead).

+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Spies. Spy operations take 25% less time. Enemy Spies level reduced by 2 in your lands. 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives capacity to build an extra Spy with the Castles technology. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold for routes to other civilizations.

When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost. [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from wonders of any era is doubled. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and Sculpture [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art in addition to the usual [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Each city can build one more district than usual (exceeding the normal limit based on [ICON_Citizen] Population).
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.
Builds Holy Sites districts in half the time. Can purchase any unit with faith.

+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions. Combat victories provide [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in the Holy Site if they are next to a Forest. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold in the Commercial Hub and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in the Theater Square if they are next to a Mountain.
All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest and move faster in forests.

Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast; naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Builds Encampment, Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time.
New cities start with a free building, usually a Monument. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold in the Harbor if they are next to Coast.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Arad Doman. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Arad Doman provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Arad Doman. +4 [ICON_Food] Food from domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Gold for Arad Doman.

Capture defeated enemy units as Damane. Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. Units ignore additional [ICON_Movement] Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's. Spend Builder charges to complete 20% of the original district cost.
Commercial Hubs gives 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 1 [ICON_Food] Food per adjacency to Desert or Desert Hills. Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations.

Commercial Hubs gives 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and 1 [ICON_Food] Food per adjacency to Desert or Desert Hills. Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations. Units do not receive damage from Dust Storms.
Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Desert.

Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual. Unit maintenance cost reduced by 4 Gold per turn, per unit. Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations. The worship building is enhanced to add 10% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual. Unit maintenance cost reduced by 4 Gold per turn, per unit. Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations. The worship building is enhanced to add 10% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith. Units do not receive damage from Dust Storms.

+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions. Combat victories provide [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Can purchase any unit with faith.

+5% [ICON_Culture] Culture per city-state you are the Suzerain of. After recruiting or patronizing a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, 20% of its [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point cost is refunded.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government. Units do not receive damage from Dust Storms.
All Pastures gain +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. All Plantations gain +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles.
It’s time to toss the dice
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. [ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide 60% of civics and technologies instead of 50%.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.

+15% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River. All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district. All Fishing boats gain +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Desert and Plains
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states.

+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Spies. Spy operations take 25% less time. Enemy Spies level reduced by 2 in your lands. 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives capacity to build an extra Spy with the Castles technology.
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent.

Luxury resources in his territory provide an [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to 2 extra cities. Military units receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each different Luxury resource improved in Graendal's lands.
Andor unique anti-cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks.
Unique Siege unit, +7 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength vs. district defenses.
Tar Valon unique ranged unit that replace the Crossbowman. This unit is stronger than the Crossbowman and it heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking.
Tar Valon unique heavy cavalry unit that replace the Knight. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Aes Sedai unit.
Elaida unique anti-cavalry unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Tar Valon unique anti-cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in a district.
Shienar unique heavy cavalry unit that replace the Knight. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking ranged and siege units.
Saldea unique light cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on your capital's continent.
Amadicia unique melee unit. If this unit captures a city or is adjacent to a city when it is captured, the city will automatically adopt the Whitecloak player's Religion as the dominant Religion.
Ghealdan unique anti-cavalry unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Legion of the Wall unit.
Arad Doman unique light cavalry unit. [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for killing units.
Seanchan unique melee unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Deathwatch Guard unit.
Seanchan unique anti-cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. fortified defender.
Seanchan unique ranged unit that replace the Crossbowman. This unit is stronger than the Crossbowman.
Seanchan unique light cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. cavalry units.
Seanchan unique heavy cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. cavalry units.
Aiel unique anti-cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Maidens of the Spear unit.
Aiel unique anti-cavalry unit.+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills
Aiel unique ranged unit. Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Aiel unique light cavalry unit. Faster movement on Hill terrain and doesn't require horses.
Aiel unique heavy cavalry unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. melee and ranged units and doesn't require Iron.
Aiel unique melee unit. Can move after attacking and doesn't require Iron.
Dark One unique anti-cavalry unit. 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory.
Dark One unique anti-cavalry unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Dark One unique melee unit. [ICON_Culture] Culture is earned from kills on their [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.
Dark One unique ranged unit. Pillaging costs only 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement point.
Dark One unique light cavalry unit. Can move after attacking and doesn't require horses.
Dark One unique heavy cavalry unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all adjacent enemy units.
Dark One unique anti-cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's. No disembark cost.
Illian unique light cavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against damaged units.
Rahvid unique anti-cavalry unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Tear unique anti-cavalry unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in a district.
Dragon unique melee unit. When defeating an enemy unit, spread their religion to nearby cities.
Dragon unique ranged unit, stronger than the crossbowman
Two Rivers unique ranged unit, 1 more range than the Crossbowman
Two Rivers unique light cavalry unit, 1 more sight and +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
Borderlands unique melee unit, +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory or adjacent to your territory.
Andor unique buldings. Provides +2 Housing, +4 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Can only be build in the Capital.

Tar Valon unique District that replace the Campus. +2 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for adjacency to River. Minor [ICON_Science] Science bonus for adjacent district tiles and adjacent Rainforest tiles.

Shienar unique District for city growth. Replaces the Aqueduct district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center. In either case, the Bath provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Must be built adjacent to the City Center. Gives culture for each citizen.
Kandor unique District that replace the Comercial Hub district which provides a large amount of [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Camp.
Kandor unique Improvement. Occupying unit receives +6 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. It provides +2 [ICON_Production] if next to a Encampent.
Cairhien unique Improvement. +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Plantations or Camps.
Altara unique Bulding that replace the Monument. +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Altara unique Bulding that replace the Arena. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Tarabon unique Bulding that replace the Workshop. Gives +3 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 Points for Great Engineer and +1 Points for Great Scientist.
Arad Doman unique Bulding that replace the Library. Gives +3 [ICON_Science] Science, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 Points for Great Scientist.
